Everything else was ok.
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set 14

reviewText: Warning: though this review does not spoil future events it does reference previous ones, so please do not read if you have not seen boxset 13.The previous boxset was, in my opinion, the highpoint of Naruto's story so far. Unfortunately, it ended with a shocking cliffhanger as Hinata was ruthlessly cut down by Pain, moments after she declared her love for Naruto. The grief caused by this callous act sees Naruto give in to his rage, and consequently, the Nine Tails Fox. It is here that boxset 14 begins. Contains 13 episodes ( 167 - 179).The introduction of this boxset is an explosive one, as Naruto (enveloped in the Nine Tails' chakra) unleashes all of his rage at Pain, resulting in a devastating showcase of powers from both men. The battle is nothing short of epic, and the level of strength displayed from both Naruto and Pain is jaw dropping. As is befitting such a seismic battle the animation is superb; resulting in a fluid, free flowing fight which is breathtaking to watch in motion. What's most amazing about this battle, however, is the lengths both Pain and Naruto will go too to win; the jutsus on display eclipse anything seen in Naruto before, they're truly jaw dropping in both scale and ambition.In this boxset there's little doubt that episodes 167 - 169 are the best ones as they contain unforgettable moments; but then along comes filler.  In this set the filler is distributed seemingly at random, but overall there are six filler episodes in total. What's bizarre about these filler episodes is not just their placement - they come before Pains backstory, and then after the arc ends - but their content that is the problem. For some reason, it was decided that we should go back in time to the good old days when Naruto was 12, the third Hokage was still alive and Sasuke was a confused, but ultimately reliable friend, and join them on a quest to find the 4th Hokage's legacy. On the one hand this represents a chance for fans who have followed the series since the beginning to reminisce and feel nostalgic (these episodes contain the old soundtrack from part 1) on the other hand though, these episodes have absolutely no relevance to the main story arc and are frankly, rubbish. If you haven't seen the old Naruto episodes (1-135)  then I recommend that you do as they're brilliant, but don't waste your time watching these non canon filler "flashbacks" of events that never actually happened.After these two filler specials (they were made to generate interest for Naruto movie 4, starring the 4th Hokage) there is a return to great canon material. The canon episodes that follow wrap up the Pain arc excellently whilst also explaining what drove Pain to become the way he is. After hearing his side of the story one can't help but feel for him and his fellow orphans, and the difficult life they have had. Masashi Kishimoto once again displays that storytelling is one of his greatest strengths, and fans will not be disappointed at how this arc ends.As ever, the music is great with the standout track Hisou (Tragedy) providing the epic BGM that this series deserves.Overall, this is a great boxset for fans of Naruto and is highly recommended to all anime fans.
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set 14

reviewText: The previous box set was great.  Showed some great training and character development.  This box set concludes the battle between Naruto and pain.  Also includes the fourth hokage parts.  This box set is going to one of the best to have in your collection.  To all true Naruto fans what we use to get in our "box sets" compared to now.... well you know.  But we all know that's not going to stop us from completing our collection!

reviewText: I cannot wait for this DVD release. I am kinda tired of all these fillers to drag out the anime longer, but the assault on the leaf village continues on in this set, and even concludes with Naruto being declared the hero of the leaf! I'm just excited that the episodes will be released dubbed in English! I like the show, but I don't understand Japanese language fluently, and trying to read subtitles while watching the show gets frustrating. I look forward to this set as well as set 15 & 16 which should be released later on this year Viz Media!
summary: I have ALL of Naruto's DVDs!!

Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set 14

reviewText: Naruto has always been amoung the best of Japanese anime and Manga.  It gets to the heart of what Manga can do well.  When you first meet little Naruto - he's an orphan, painting graffitti all over his village.  You learn from the village chief (the Hokage) that Naruto does this because the villagers fear him, and show him nothing but contempt.  It is Naruto's way of getting people to notice him.  He vows to one day be the Hokage, and have all the villagers acknowledge him.  Naruto begins his journey in that original series.  The Shippuden Series is that little boy now a young man.  He gains friends and family along the way, things he has constantly yearned for.  He has worked hard at his skills and become a good ninja, but a greater friend and comrade to all whose lives he touches.  Naruto also had a secret, inside of him, he has the captured chakra (spiritual energy) of the nine-tails beast - a wicked and powerful demon that could easily destroy whole cities.  Only Naruto's bright optimism and sense of worth keeps the beast from taking over.  Any Ninja that can see within Naruto and see the beast is amazed at how this boy can remain so happy and hopeful with such a horrible demon raging to get out.In this set, Naruto is finally recognized for the hero he is to his village.  He is not yet Hokage, but he gains what he truly yearned for, and what his great father wished for him, to be known as a true hero of his village.  I have not given up any details of this set, that's for you to explore, but I hope I have convinced you the trip is worth it.
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set 14

reviewText: I collect Anime and I am collecting the Naruto Shippuden Series. This box set worked great and was a good story in the Series.
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set 14

reviewText: The set shows us the conclusion of the Pein/Naruto conflict arc as we see the finale between Naruto who has lived his life knowing sorrow,despair,loneliness and being ostracized but amazingly has kept his hope alive still unlike Pein who feels the world has to be remade which hopefully stops the sorrowful cycle of war and pain.  Also we get a few episodes of young Naruto before becoming a ninja for the leaf village and see some of the senseless cruelty of the hypocritical villagers as they ostracize and even angrily Naruto's existence,even to a small point Iruka before he realizes the truth.  While I've always found Naruto to be my favorite and his selfless heroic spirit I just have to wonder why he'd continue to show a willingness to protect those who have been so cruel to him but again that's what makes a hero.  The set is pretty much the same as the recent Shippuden sets from set 5 onward meaning three dvd's in a single case with a plastic flap inside so the discs don't overlap each other. The extras are pretty much the same as the other sets to but most of us never really bother with the extras too much to begin with. So for fans of Naruto we finally are now able to add the conclusion of one of the biggest story arc yet of the Naruto universe to our anime library.
summary: Meeting Between Two Choosen Ones,One Fallen One Hopeful
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set 14
